name: Animal & Plant Health Association
membership: Members of ECPA and AHE and Health for Animals
goal:
The Animal and Plant Health Association (APHA) is the representative body for manufacturers and sole distributors of animal health (veterinary medicines) and plant health (plant protection/agrochemical) products in Ireland. These industries play a vital role in providing high quality food at an economic cost whilst protecting the environment.

APHA represents the interests of its members to Government, related industries and the general public.

To ensure Ireland is represented at European level, APHA is a member of the ECPA (European Crop Protection Association) and the AHE (Animal Health Europe).
interests: Agriculture and Rural Development, Climate Action, Competition, Consumers, Environment, Food Safety, Maritime affairs and fisheries, Public Health, Research and innovation
euInitiatives: Currently we are specifically interested in developments related to Reg 04 and Reg 06/2019.  We are also interested in all legislation that will impact on the manufacture, distribution, sale and supply of pesticides so have a particular interest in the review of Reg 1107 / 2009. We are also interested in discussions relating to Biocides, especially rodenticides, disinfectants and detergents.
